The most common skin type. Combination skin has areas that are oily (usually the T-zone: forehead, nose, and chin) and areas that are normal or dry (usually the cheeks).
The most common skin type. Has areas that are oily and areas that are normal or dry.
Oily skin produces excess sebum (oil), making it shiny and prone to breakouts. You might experience larger pores and a greasy feeling throughout the day.
Excess oil leads to shine, breakouts, and larger pores, leaving your face feeling greasy.
Dry skin lacks moisture, making it feel tight, flaky, and itchy. It might also appear rough and have visible fine lines.
Lacks moisture, feels tight, flaky, and itchy, with visible fine lines.

Characterized by a few pimples or blemishes, often called \"mild acne.\" It includes some blackheads, whiteheads, or minor pimples. The skin appears mostly clear, with occasional manageable breakouts.
Few pimples, mostly whiteheads or blackheads. Skin mostly clear with occasional breakouts.
Moderate acne level involves more pimples and blemishes, both inflamed and non-inflamed. It affects larger areas, including the face, back, and chest, with noticeable redness and inflammation.
More pimples, inflamed and non-inflamed, with redness and inflammation.

Severe acne level involves numerous, often painful blemishes, including deep cysts and nodules, also known as \"cystic acne.\" It can cause significant scarring and affects large, inflamed areas, leading to discomfort and potential psychological impacts.
Numerous, painful blemishes, including deep cysts and nodules. Can cause scarring and significant discomfort.
Fair to light skin tones typically have a pale or ivory complexion. They may burn easily in the sun and often have freckles or a slight pink undertone.
Pale or ivory complexion, burns easily in the sun, with freckles or a slight pink undertone.
Light to medium skin tones range from beige to olive. They have more melanin than fair skin, offering some protection against UV damage, but may still experience sunburn.
Beige to olive complexion, more melanin than fair skin, with some protection against UV damage.
Medium to dark skin tones encompass a wide range of shades, from tan to deep brown. They contain higher levels of melanin, providing natural sun protection and reduced susceptibility to sunburn.
Tan to deep brown complexion, higher melanin levels, with natural sun protection and reduced sunburn susceptibility.
Unlock Your Skin\'s Secrets with a Selfie!
Check Your Skin Result / Take a New Picture
